metadata.subject: Fwd: Do a good deed today...

analysis.purpose: To organize a mass mailing campaign to President Trump advocating for preserving and improving the Affordable Care Act
analysis.significance: Shows political activism efforts during the early Trump administration regarding healthcare policy

notable_quotes: "Don't make America sick again. Improve Obamacare. Don't repeal it."
Can you imagine the picture of 53 MILLION letters arriving at the White House by January 26th? It will be a mountain.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is a political advocacy campaign

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is legitimate political advocacy

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a grassroots political advocacy email chain about healthcare policy during the Trump administration

analysis.summary: This email chain forwards a political advocacy campaign urging recipients to mail letters to President Trump on January 23, 2017, with the message 'Don't make America sick again. Improve Obamacare. Don't repeal it' as part of an effort to preserve the Affordable Care Act.
